intro: Thapsus floccosum, commonly known as the woolly thapsus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
